Class ec.ezlib.base.ParseNode 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ezlib.base.ParseNode
public abstract class ParseNode
extends Object
implements ValueMaker, MatchMaker
A ParseNode of a program written in "kernel EZ". A program written in EZ is immediately expanded to kernel EZ, hopefully passing source position through successfully.

ParseNode()
A bit of a kludge, but we initialize the source after construction to avoid propogating source-tracking logic through all subclasses.
ParseNode(ParseNode, Object)
For use by similar subclass constructors, used in turn by substitute() methods.

printOn
printOn 
 public abstract void printOn(IndentWriter os) throws IOException
Pretty print this syntactic construct assuming the specified ambient indent level. The convention is that any leading or trailing whitespace (newlines, indentation, etc...) is handled by my caller. I just print from my first printing character to my last one, indenting as appropriate for internal newlines.

lnPrintOn 
 public void lnPrintOn(IndentWriter os) throws IOException
Onto os, first print a newline, then spaces to the designated indent level, then pretty print this parse node. "printOn" vs "lnPrintOn" is much like the conventional disctinction between "print" and "println", except that the newlines come first (hence the weird spelling), and the newline is followed by indentation.

printListOn 
 public static void printListOn(String left,
                                ParseNode nodes[],
                                String sep,
                                String right,
                                IndentWriter os) throws IOException
Print the left bracket, then the nodes separated by sep, and then the right bracket

 protected static boolean matchBind(ParseNode optTemplate,
                                    Object args,
                                    ParseNode optSpecimen,

Convenience method for handling nulls. nulls must match exactly.

substitute 
 protected static ParseNode[] substitute(ParseNode templates[],
                                         Object args)
Convenience method for creating a substituted array. If template[i] is null, then result[i] will be null.

matchBind 
 protected static boolean matchBind(ParseNode templates[],
                                    Object args,
                                    ParseNode specimens[],
                                    Vector bindings)
Convenience method for matching corresponding arrays. null members must match exactly.
